message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public void remove(Map<String,User> removeUser){
  Iterator<Map.Entry<String, User>> iterator = removeUser.entrySet().iterator();
  while(iterator.hasNext()){
    Map.Entry<String, User> entry = iterator.next();
    if(!entry.getValue().isActive()){
      iterator.remove();
    }
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The ConcurrentModificationException is thrown when you try to modify a collection while iterating over it using the for-each loop. The correct way to remove elements while iterating over a collection is to use an Iterator. The Iterator's remove() method ensures safe removal of elements.
